FuncDef:
The active ipsec bandwidth-enhance command increases the IPSec bandwidth of a base-board on a VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VUSI-400A-S board.
The undo active ipsec bandwidth-enhance command restores the default IPSec bandwidth configuration.
By default, the IPSec bandwidth of VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VUSI-400A-S is 0 Gbit/s.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the bandwidth.
The value is an integer that ranges from 10 to 600, in Gbit/s.

Specifies the slot ID of a board.
The value is a string of 1 to 15 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The value is the number of the slot where the board is located.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
This command is supported only on the VSUI-400A/VSUI-400/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400-S/VUSI-400A-S service board.
If you have purchased a license, you can run the active ipsec bandwidth-enhance command to increase the IPSec bandwidth. IPSec function cannot be used normally on VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VUSI-400A-S without activated license.
Assume that the board is installed in slot 1. After you run the active ipsec bandwidth-enhance 40 slot 1 command to increase the bandwidth by 40 Gbit/s, the bandwidth of the board becomes 40 Gbit/s.
Prerequisites
The license file that defines bandwidth resources has been activated.
